definition: to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
a period of time/phase/stage/classifier for issues of a periodical, courses of study/time/term/period/to hope/Taiwan pr. [qi2]

sentences.english: Generics can help you resolve coding problems earlier in the development cycle.
sentences.chinese: 泛型可以幫助您在開發週期的早期解決編碼問題。

sentences.english: Early in the development lifecycle, one uses simulation and analysis tools.
sentences.chinese: 在開發週期的前期階段，使用仿真和分析工具。

sentences.english: Design-time governance controls all phases and activities around the software development lifecycle.
sentences.chinese: 設計時期治理控制軟件開發週期內的所有階段和活動。

sentences.english: The process of tailoring the framework usually occurs early in the development cycle.
sentences.chinese: 裁剪框架的過程通常發生在開發週期的早期。

sentences.english: A typical development cycle starts by capturing and analyzing business requirements and goals.
sentences.chinese: 典型的開發週期從獲取和分析商業需求和目的開始。
